title: Did Jane Fonda Say COVID-19 Was 'God's Gift to the Left'?
subtitle: The controversial actor and left-wing activist provoked an outraged response in October 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In October 2020, actress Jane Fonda said the COVID-19 coronavirus pandemic was "God's gift to the Left."

title: Did Kamala Harris Say Protests Are 'Not Gonna Let Up, and They Should Not'?
subtitle: Comments by the Democratic vice presidential candidate led to claims that she encourages rioting.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: In a June 2020 interview, U.S. Democratic vice presidential candidate Kamala Harris said of the nationwide anti-police brutality protests:

title: Is This Bernie Sanders' 1978 New Year's Resolution?
subtitle: The 1970s version of Sanders sounds very familiar to modern audiences.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: An image reproduces Bernie Sanders' 1978 New Year's resolution, as given to a local Vermont newspaper.

title: Did Biden Say Americans Could Stay Home During Pandemic Because 'Some Black Woman' Stocked Grocery Shelves?
subtitle: A 10-second-clip from a 90-minute event was missing some context.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden said that Americans were able to stay home during the COVID-19 pandemic because "some Black woman was able to stack the grocery shelf."

title: Did a Twitter User Predict Trump's COVID-19 Announcement?
subtitle: A widely shared tweet, supposedly written in mid-September, predicted that "Trump's October surprise will be the announcement of 'his infection.'"
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: On Sept. 18, 2020, Twitter user @JohnCammo predicted that U.S. President Donald Trump would announce in October that he had tested positive for COVID-19.

title: Did Biden Call Trump 'Xenophobic'?
subtitle: The Democratic presidential nominee's critique of the incumbent came amid the coronavirus pandemic.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Democratic 2020 presidential nominee Joe Biden called U.S. President Donald Trump "xenophobic."

title: Did Roger Stone Say Trump Should Declare Martial Law If He Loses Election?
subtitle: The president's former campaign adviser, convicted for lying to Congress, joined conspiracy theorist Alex Jones in describing a convoluted plot to "steal" the 2020 election.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2020, Roger Stone said U.S. President Donald Trump should, if he loses the November election, declare martial law.

title: Did Chinese Virologist Dr. Li-Meng Yan Say COVID-19 Was Made in a Wuhan Lab?
subtitle: It's not the first time the controversial doctor made such claims about the origin of the global pandemic.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: In September 2020, Dr. Li-Meng Yan, a former post-doctoral student at Hong Kong University, appeared In multiple televised interviews claiming that she had proof SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19, was manufactured by the Chinese Communist Party in a Wuhan Lab.

title: Did Ginsburg Say Her 'Most Fervent Wish' Was Not To Be Replaced by Trump?
subtitle: The U.S. Supreme Court justice dictated a message to her granddaughter shortly before she died.
author: Dan Evon
statement: As transcribed by her granddaughter, U.S. Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg said: "My most fervent wish is that I will not be replaced until a new president is installed."

title: Did Trump Say Wildfires Are Caused by Exploding Trees?
subtitle: Trump made a comment about trees and wildfires during a visit to fire-ravaged California.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump stated "exploding trees" played a role in West Coast wildfires.

title: Did Trump Say the Military Had No Ammunition When He Took Office?
subtitle: A claim made by President Donald Trump has actually been on the internet for years.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said the military didn't have any ammunition when he took office.

title: Did Trump Say in February 2020 That COVID-19 Is Deadlier Than the Flu?
subtitle: While the president repeatedly downplayed the deadliness of COVID-19 in public, he acknowledged that it is deadlier than the flu in private.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Trump acknowledged that COVID-19 is deadlier than the flu in early February 2020, but continued to downplay the pandemic as "like the flu" in public.

title: Did Trump Say Protesters Threw Cans of Soup at Police?
subtitle: The president added that when questioned, protesters pretended the weaponized soup was food for their families.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: In July 2020, U.S. President Donald Trump said "anarchists" in cities across the country were throwing cans - and bags - of soup at police.

title: Did Lawyer for Alleged Kenosha Shooter Say He Will Be Known for Starting 2nd Revolutionary War?
subtitle: Differences between the April 18, 1775, "shot heard round the world" and the August 2020 killing of two people at a police brutality protest in Wisconsin are vast.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: Attorney John Pierce, who is representing 17-year-old Kyle Rittenhouse, said in a tweet his client will "go down in history" for starting a second American Revolutionary War.

title: Did Trump Call McCain a Loser?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump said that he "never called John (McCain) a loser," but that isn't true.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump called U.S. Sen. John McCain, R-Ariz., a loser.

title: Did Sarah Sanders Say Trump Told Her To Take 'One For The Team' After Kim Jong-Un Winked At Her?
subtitle: Saying something happened doesn't mean it did.
author: Jessica Lee
statement: Former U.S. White House Press Secretary Sarah Sanders said Donald Trump told her to take "one for the team" after North Korea's leader, Kim Jong-un, apparently winked at her.

title: Did Trump Say This About His Plans for a Second Term?
subtitle: The president "has strained to define what his second-term agenda would be."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A quote meme reproduced U.S. President Trump's August 2020 statement about his plans for a second term.

title: Did a BLM Organizer Say, 'I Don't Care If Someone Decides to Loot'?
subtitle: Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot said of the looting,
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Black Lives Matter organizer said, "I don't care if someone decides to loot."

title: Did RNC Speaker Abby Johnson Advocate 'Household Voting'?
subtitle: The anti-abortion activist tweeted that she believes in "one vote" per "Godly household," with husbands having the final say.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Abby Johnson, an anti-abortion activist who spoke at the 2020 Republican National Convention, earlier advocated for 'household voting' in which a husband would 'get the final say.'

title: Did Trump Say 'We Should Get a Redo of Four Years'?
subtitle: The comment during a Wisconsin campaign rally was widely interpreted to mean the president might seek a third term.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump stated during a 2020 reelection campaign rally, "We should get a redo of four years" - meaning redo his first term after reelection - effectively grant him a third term.

title: Did Trump Say of Women, 'You Have To Treat 'Em Like Shit'?
subtitle: Claims about the president's past pronouncements reemerged in August 2020, when Joe Biden named Kamala Harris as his running mate.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 1992 Donald Trump was quoted saying of women, "You have to treat 'em like shit."

title: Did Biden Make This Statement About Democracy During a Pandemic?
subtitle: "We can both have a democracy and elections and at the same time protect the public health," the Democratic presidential contender declared.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A meme reproduces a statement Joe Biden made during an interview about continuing democracy during the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Did Kamala Harris Make These Contrasting Statements About Police?
subtitle: Whether those contrasting statements document the senator to be a "hypocrite" is a thornier question.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A meme documents contradictory statements about the value of enhanced police presence offered by Kamala Harris.

title: Did Joe Biden Ask a Reporter, 'Are You a Junkie'?
subtitle: The question was in response to a journalist's query about Biden's cognitive fitness for office.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: During an interview, presumed U.S. Democratic 2020 presidential nominee Joe Biden asked a news reporter,

title: Did Trump Say 'Nobody Likes Me'?
subtitle: During a White House press briefing, the president compared his approval ratings with those of fellow members of the coronavirus task force.
author: Madison Dapcevich
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said
during a live White House COVID-19 press briefing.

title: Did Sen. Cotton Say Slavery Was a 'Necessary Evil'?
subtitle: The Republican senator faced backlash after he criticized a school curriculum on slavery.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: In July 2020, U.S. Sen. Tom Cotton criticized a school curriculum based on The New York Times' The 1619 project by saying of slavery, "As the Founding Fathers said, it was the necessary evil upon which the union was built..."

title: Did Kanye West Say Harriet Tubman Didn't Free Slaves?
subtitle: The controversy-prone artist has said a lot of things.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Kanye West said, "Harriet Tubman never actually freed the slaves."

title: Did Goya Foods' CEO Praise Trump?
subtitle: #Goyaway called for a boycott of the popular Hispanic food and seasonings company in July 2020.
author: Nur Ibrahim
statement: In a July 2020 press conference, Goya Foods CEO Robert Unanue said, "We are all truly blessed" to have a leader like Donald Trump, leading to online calls for a boycott of the company's products.

title: Did Elon Musk Tell Kanye West, 'We May Have More Differences of Opinion Than I Anticipated'?
subtitle: Endorsing someone for president without knowing the platform they'll be running on is generally a bad idea.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Elon Musk tweeted, "we may have more differences of opinion than I anticipated" when shown an article about Kanye West's 2020 presidential platform.

title: Did Dr. Fauci Say NIH Was Told To Cancel Grant for Coronavirus Emergence Research?
subtitle: The comment was made during testimony before a congressional committee.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Dr. Anthony Fauci said the National Institutes of Health (NIH) was told to cancel a grant funding research for a study investigating how coronaviruses jump from bats to humans.

title: Did Rabbi Michael Beals Call Joe Biden a 'Mensch'?
subtitle: "Mensch" is a Yiddish word that means "a person of integrity and honor."
author: Dan Evon
statement: Rabbi Michael Beals called Joe Biden a "mensch" in an article about the then-senator attending a shiva minyan.

title: Did Activist Shaun King Say 'White Jesus' Statues Should Come Down?
subtitle: King's tweet came as statues of historical figures were being toppled or removed in 2020.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Racial justice activist Shaun King said statues of "white Jesus" should be torn down.

title: Did Trump Brag That He 'Made Juneteenth Very Famous'?
subtitle: In a recent interview, the president bragged that "I did something good."
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: President Donald Trump bragged that he

title: Did Trump Say, 'I Love the Poorly Educated'?
subtitle: Trump's "poorly educated" line sparked much reaction, including smirking and shock.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Donald Trump once said, "I love the poorly educated."

title: Did Ted Cruz Say Democrats Wanted to 'Arrest Churchgoers' but Not 'Looters'?
subtitle: Cruz criticized Democratic political leaders for what he perceived to be leniency.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Sen. Ted Cruz criticized Democratic legislators for wanting to "arrest" churchgoers but not "looters."

title: Did Trump Say 'This Is a Great Day' for George Floyd?
subtitle: The president's comments came during a press conference about employment statistics on June 5, 2020.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: On June 5, 2020, U.S. President Donald Trump stated during a talk about employment numbers that it was a "great day" for George Floyd, a black man who was killed May 25 after a Minneapolis police officer kneeled on his neck.

title: Did Trump Tweet in 2014 About 'Riots and Looting' Due to 'Weak Leadership'?
subtitle: Whatever the situation today might be, one can usually find an old Trump tweet about it.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Trump tweeted in 2014 that America could expect "riots and looting" due to "weak leadership in Washington."

title: Did Piers Morgan End His Friendship with Trump in an Open Letter?
subtitle: The fallout apparently began when U.S. President Donald Trump unfollowed Morgan on Twitter.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: British media personality Piers Morgan penned a scathing open letter to U.S. President Donald Trump, marking the end of their years-long friendship.

title: Did Trump Say He 'Tested Very Positively' for COVID-19, Meaning Negative?
subtitle: Is the president trying to confuse us?
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said he "tested very positively" for COVID-19, meaning his test results came back negative, and he did not have the coronavirus disease.

title: Did Pelosi Say 'Civilization as We Know It Today Is at Stake' About 2020 Election?
subtitle: Whether accurate or not, a quote shared online can quickly travel a long way away from its original context.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said "civilization as we know it today is at stake" in regards to the 2020 presidential election.

title: Did Trump Call MSNBC Host Nicole Wallace a 'Dog'?
subtitle: A tweet posted by the U.S. president prompted questions about whether it was real.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump called MSNBC host Nicole Wallace a "dog."

title: Did Bill Mitchell Tweet 'Let Me Know' When COVID-19 Kills 55,000?
subtitle: The right-wing commentator received backlash on social media when the tragic benchmark was met.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Right-wing commentator Bill Mitchell tweeted "someone let me know" when 55,000 Americans have died from COVID-19 coronavirus disease.

title: Did This Nobel Prize Winner Say COVID-19 Was Created in a Lab?
subtitle: Keep in mind, the opinion of one person does not outweigh the consensus of the scientific community.
author: Dan Evon
statement: 2008 Nobel Prize winner Luc Montagnier said that COVID-19 coronavirus disease was artificially created in a lab by biologists working on an AIDS vaccine.

title: Did an Irish Times Column Express 'Pity' for the US?
subtitle: A scathing opinion column was copied and pasted then circulated online, prompting some to question its authenticity.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The Irish Times newspaper published a column by Fintan O'Toole expressing "pity" for the United States over U.S. President Donald Trump's leadership during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Did Texas' Lt. Gov. Say 'There Are More Important Things Than Living'?
subtitle: Dan Patrick called for social-distancing measures to be eased for his state amid the coronavirus pandemic.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Texas Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick said COVID-19 social-distancing restrictions should be eased because "there are more important things than living."

title: Did Trump Ask, 'How Can You Possibly Discover Anything If You Already Know Everything?'
subtitle: Or as former defense secretary Donald Rumsfeld might ask, "Do we know what the unknowns are"?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Donald Trump once questioned, "How can you possibly discover anything if you already know everything?"

title: Did Former Wells Fargo CEO Say 'Some May Even Die'?
subtitle: Richard Kovacevich didn't deny he said this about employees returning to work amid the coronavirus pandemic; however, he did point out some context was omitted.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: In regards to reopening the economy during the COVID-19 pandemic, the former CEO of Wells Fargo stated, "We'll gradually bring those people back and see what happens. Some of them will get sick, some may even die, I don't know."

title: Did Trump Say This About the COVID-19 Pandemic?
subtitle: Two statements the U.S. president made roughly a week apart in March 2020 came under intense scrutiny.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A meme documents U.S. President Donald Trump's statements about the COVID-19 pandemic in March 2020.

title: Did Cristina Higgins Pen This Facebook Post About Coronavirus in Italy?
subtitle: A personal account concerning the spread of COVID-19 in Italy went viral in March 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Cristina Higgins authored a personal account about the spread of COVID-19 in Italy.

title: Did a Doctor in Italy Warn Coronavirus Wasn't Just a 'Bad Flu'?
subtitle: Physician: "The situation is now nothing short of dramatic. No other words come to mind."
author: Dan Evon
statement: A doctor in Italy shared numerous details about how hospitals in the country are dealing with COVID-19, a disease caused by the new coronavirus.

title: Did Joe Biden Say He Didn't Want His Kids Growing Up in a 'Racial Jungle'?
subtitle: The 2020 Democratic presidential candidate's history with busing has haunted him on the campaign trail.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden once said he didn't want his kids to grow up in a "racial jungle" in regards to desegregation.

title: Did an Infectious Disease Specialist Write 'I Am Not Scared of COVID-19'?
subtitle: Readers inquired about a viral Facebook post amid an outbreak of the new coronavirus in 2020.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: Dr. Abdu Sharkawy, an infectious diseases specialist, penned a viral Facebook post warning about the loss of reason in the face of panic over the new coronavirus in 2020.

title: Did Joe Biden Say 150 Million Americans Have Been Killed By Guns Since '07?
subtitle: For perspective, the United States has roughly 330 million residents.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Democratic 2020 presidential candidate Joe Biden said during a debate that "150 million people have been killed [by guns] since 2007."

title: Did a Noted Pathologist Write This Viral Coronavirus Advice Letter?
subtitle: Amid an outbreak of coronavirus in 2020, an email from pathologist James Robb was heavily memed and exaggerated.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: A letter providing tips on how to protect against the new coronavirus was authored by pathologist James Robb.

title: Did Bloomberg Say Sanders Would Have Beaten Trump in 2016?
subtitle: It wasn't necessarily a compliment.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Michael Bloomberg said that U.S. Sen. Bernie Sanders would have beaten Donald Trump in the 2016 election if Sanders had been the Democratic nominee.

title: Did Michelle Obama Praise Harvey Weinstein as a 'Wonderful Human Being' in 2013?
subtitle: The former first lady thanked Weinstein for his role in a White House student film event - four years before dozens of women first publicly accused him of rape, sexual assault, and sexual harassment.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2013 then-first lady Michelle Obama praised Harvey Weinstein as a "wonderful human being" and a "good friend."

title: Did Bloomberg Say Elderly Cancer Patients Should Not Be Treated To Alleviate Health Care Costs?
subtitle: The billionaire businessman and 2020 Democratic presidential candidate faced renewed criticism for remarks he made in 2011.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2011 Mike Bloomberg said health care providers should not treat elderly prostate cancer patients in order to alleviate health care costs and overcrowding.

title: Did Biden Say Poor Kids Are 'Just as Talented as White Kids'?
subtitle: An example of what candidates should avoid, especially if their record on race has already come under intense scrutiny.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden asserted during a speech that

title: Did Bruce Springsteen Say Trump 'Doesn't Have a Grasp' on What It Means To Be American?
subtitle: "I didn't need little Bruce Springsteen," Trump proclaimed at a campaign rally.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Bruce Springsteen said U.S. President Donald Trump "doesn't have a grasp of the deep meaning of what it means to be an American.

title: Did Jimmy Carter Say 'Jesus Never Said a Word About Homosexuality'?
subtitle: "When we go to the Bible we should keep in mind that the basic principles of the Bible are taught by God, but written down by human beings deprived of modern day knowledge," Carter said.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former U.S. President Jimmy Carter once noted that "Jesus never said a word about homosexuality"?

title: Did Mike Bloomberg Say 'Anybody Can Be a Farmer,' Tech Work Requires 'More Gray Matter'?
subtitle: South Dakota's Republican governor accused the 2020 presidential candidate of "pompous ignorance" for remarks he made in 2016.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In 2016 Mike Bloomberg said he "could teach anybody to be a farmer" but information technology required "a lot more gray matter."

title: Does This Trump Tweet Echo 'Mein Kampf'?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump has repeatedly labeled the "fake news media" as the "enemy of the people."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A tweet from U.S. President Donald Trump attacking the press echoes a passage from Hitler's "Mein Kampf."

title: Did Richard Branson Say Trump Spent a 2-Hour Lunch Speaking of Revenge?
subtitle: The Virgin Group founder wrote that Donald Trump vowed to "spend the rest of his life destroying five people" who had declined to help him.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Virgin Group founder Richard Branson said that years ago Donald Trump spent the entirety of a two-hour lunch vowing to "spend the rest of his life destroying five people" who had declined to help him.

title: Did a 1933 Article Report That Hitler Would Not 'Disrupt' Germany?
subtitle: Events always seem more obvious and predictable after they have already taken place.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A 1933 Wall Street Journal article reported expectations that Hitler would not "disrupt" Germany.

title: Did Rush Limbaugh Say Nicotine Was Not Proven To Be Addictive?
subtitle: Some detractors hinted at a degree of irony in this quote after the conservative radio host announced his lung cancer diagnosis in early 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Rush Limbaugh once said, "It has not been proven that nicotine is addictive."

title: Did Joe Biden Say He Doesn't Count Drunken Driving as a Felony?
subtitle: During a candidates forum in Iowa, the former vice president weighed in on the driving question as it related to immigration reform.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Former U.S. Vice President Joe Biden said he doesn't consider drunken driving a felony.

title: Did Kobe Suggest Trump Is Too Divisive to 'Make America Great Again'?
subtitle: The political quote was widely circulated after the NBA legend's death in January 2020.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Kobe Bryant once said a president "Whose name alone creates division and anger. Whose words inspire dissension and hatred can't possibly 'Make America Great Again.'"

title: Did Trump Say 'We're Going to Take the Firearms First and Then Go to Court'?
subtitle: Red flag laws allow law enforcement agencies to act on court orders and remove guns from people considered a harm to themselves or others.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said "We're going to take the firearms first and then go to court."

title: Did Dershowitz Say He Was 'Not Happy Seeing Nixon's Gang Being Tried by Blacks and Liberals'?
subtitle: Searching the long quote trails of public figures often turns up interesting statements from days past.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Alan Dershowitz once said he was "not happy seeing Nixon's gang being tried by blacks and liberals" in D.C.

title: Did Teddy Roosevelt Say 'Patriotism Means to Stand by the Country ... Not the President'?
subtitle: This famous quote about patriotism has been circulating for more than 100 years.
author: Dan Evon
statement: U.S. President Teddy Roosevelt once said, "Patriotism means to stand by the country. It does not mean to stand by the president."

title: Did Mike Pompeo Say 'We Will Continue to Fight These Battles Until the Rapture'?
subtitle: White evangelical Christians are a powerful force in the Republican Party.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Did Mike Pompeo declare, "We will continue to fight these battles. It is a never-ending struggle ... until the Rapture."

title: Did Eleanor Roosevelt Say This About the Word 'Liberal'?
subtitle: "A strange thing happened to that word," read a quotation attributed to the former first lady that was shared widely on social media in January 2020.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: A quotation attributed to Eleanor Roosevelt, in a widely shared meme in January 2020, was authentic and accurate.

title: Did Ivanka Trump Say 'Perception Is More Important Than Reality'?
subtitle: The expanded version: "If someone perceives something to be true, it is more important than if it is in fact true."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: First daughter Ivanka Trump once said that "perception is more important than reality."

title: Did Trump Really Say This About Wind and Windmills?
subtitle: The president raised eyebrows in December 2019 with a somewhat baffling attack on the use of wind turbines.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In a December 2019 speech, U.S. President Donald Trump said "I never understood wind" and made other somewhat disjointed remarks about wind power.

title: Did Comedian Michelle Wolf Joke That Her Abortion Made Her Feel 'Powerful' and Godlike?
subtitle: Right-leaning websites accurately quoted something Wolf said during a stand-up comedy performance.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In her Netflix stand-up comedy special "Joke Show," Michelle Wolf joked that having an abortion made her feel "very powerful" and akin to God.

title: Did Russian State TV Refer to President Trump as an 'Agent'?
subtitle: We should note here that the term was in quotation marks.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Russian state television called U.S. President Donald Trump an "agent."

title: Did Trump Express Concerns Over Toilet Regulations?
subtitle: "People are flushing toilets 10 times, 15 times," the president was reported to have said.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In December 2019, U.S. President Donald Trump said he had instructed the EPA to examine existing regulations limiting water pressure in toilets and showers, and claimed "People are flushing toilets 10 times, 15 times."

title: Did Pastor Rick Wiles Call Trump Impeachment a 'Jew Coup'?
subtitle: The Florida pastor used his online channel TruNews to launch a virulently anti-Semitic attack on leading congressional Democrats.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Rick Wiles said U.S. congressional impeachment proceedings against President Donald Trump amounted to a "Jew coup."

title: Did a UC Berkeley Instructor Say Rural Americans Are 'Bad People'?
subtitle: Jackson Kernion, a doctoral student in philosophy, became the focus of online outrage after he posted a series of tweets in November 2019.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Jackson Kernion, a graduate instructor in philosophy at UC Berkeley, wrote on Twitter that rural Americans are "bad people who have made bad life decisions."

title: Did Alan Dershowitz Say He Was 'Appalled' at Nancy Pelosi?
subtitle: The civilian prosecution of a former president has never been undertaken in U.S. history.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Alan Dershowitz said he was "appalled at" Pelosi for "weaponizing the criminal justice system."

title: Did Donald Trump Say 'We're Building a Wall in Colorado'?
subtitle: The president raised eyebrows by suggesting his administration was constructing a border fence in a state that isn't located on the border.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In a speech in October 2019, U.S. President Donald Trump claimed his administration was building part of the border wall in Colorado.

title: Did Trump Say People with Down Syndrome Too Often Face 'Terminations of Their Lives Before Birth'?
subtitle: U.S. President Donald Trump issued a Down Syndrome Awareness Month proclamation in October 2019.
author: David Emery
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump said people with Down syndrome "risk being subjected to the too-often terminations of their lives before birth."

title: Did UN Official Say Nations Would Vanish If Global Warming Not Reversed by 2000?
subtitle: An Associated Press article from 1989 is popular among climate-change deniers.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: In 1989, a senior U.N. environmental official said,

title: Did Thomas Jefferson Say the Tree of Liberty Must Be Refreshed 'With the Blood of Patriots and Tyrants'?
subtitle: A famous quote from Thomas Jefferson has been shared in support of several different opinions.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Thomas Jefferson once said that "the tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants."

title: Did a Psychiatrist Say Trump May Cause More Deaths Than Hitler, Stalin, and Mao?
subtitle: Dr. Allen Frances did make the remark on CNN's "Reliable Sources" and later expounded on what he meant by that.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: A psychiatrist said U.S. President Donald Trump may be responsible for millions more deaths than Hitler, Stalin, and Mao.

title: Did Anne Frank Write About 'Terrible Things Happening' and 'Families Torn Apart'?
subtitle: Sometimes alleged historical parallels that seem a bit too apt appear so because they actually took place.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Holocaust-era diarist Anne Frank wrote about families being torn apart and women and children being separated.

title: Did Joe Biden Say the Mass Shootings in El Paso and Dayton Happened in 'Houston' and 'Michigan'?
subtitle: Biden reportedly made the gaffe during a campaign event in San Diego, California.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Joe Biden incorrectly referred to the locations of massacres in El Paso, Texas, and Dayton, Ohio, in early August 2019 as having happened in "Houston" and "Michigan."

title: Did President Trump Say the Dayton, Ohio, Mass Shooting Was in Toledo?
subtitle: Nine people were killed by a gunman in Dayton, Ohio, in early August 2019.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. President Donald Trump referred to the mass shooting in Dayton, Ohio, in August 2019 as having happened in Toledo, Ohio.

title: Did Fox Host Brian Kilmeade Say the Term 'Invasion' Is 'Not Anti-Hispanic. It's a Fact'?
subtitle: The "Fox and Friends" host was defending President Donald Trump's rhetoric against claims of racism.
author: Alex Kasprak
statement: TV host Brian Kilmeade said,

title: Was a Statement About El Paso Mass Shooting Written by Sheriff?
subtitle: El Paso County Sheriff Richard Wiles reportedly posted a statement to his personal Facebook page.
author: Dan Evon
statement: El Paso County Sheriff Richard Wiles wrote a viral piece of text about the August 2019 mass shooting in El Paso, Texas.

title: Did U.S. Sen. Bernie Sanders Say Baltimore Was Like a 'Third World Country'?
subtitle: Like U.S. President Donald Trump, Sanders criticized living conditions in Baltimore (in 2015), just in a different context.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: U.S. Sen. Bernie Sanders compared Baltimore to a "third world country."

title: Did Jimmy Carter Pen the 'Losing My Religion for Equality' Op-Ed?
subtitle: Former U.S. President Jimmy Carter did disagree with the Southern Baptist Convention on issues of gender equality.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Jimmy Carter published an open letter entitled "Losing My Religion for Equality."

title: Is This a Transcript from a Radio Interview with U.S. Rep. Ocasio-Cortez?
subtitle: Absent proper context and punctuation, oral speech can be made to come across pretty silly.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A meme transcribes a portion of a radio interview with U.S. Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.

title: Did Alyssa Ahlgren Write 'Thoughts from a Hipster Coffee Shop'?
subtitle: Some readers questioned the authorship of this viral piece of text.
author: Dan Evon
statement: An opinion piece entitled "Thoughts from a hipster coffee shop" was written by conservative commentator Alyssa Ahlgren.

title: Did Pat Robertson Say Feminism Encourages Women to
subtitle: The former Baptist minister rose to prominence in 1960 when he founded the Christian Broadcast Network.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Pat Robertson said the feminist agenda encourages women to "kill their children, practice witchcraft, and become lesbians."

title: Did Harry Truman Denounce the Use of 'Socialism' as a 'Scare Word'?
subtitle: "Socialism is their name for almost anything that helps all the people."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: President Truman denounced the use of "socialism" as a "scare word ... for almost anything that helps all the people."

title: Did Lady Gaga Say She 'Had a Boyfriend Who Told Me I'd Never Succeed?'
subtitle: After an Oscar, a Golden Globe, and multiple Grammy Awards, it's safe to say that Lady Gaga has proved her doubting ex-boyfriend wrong.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Lady Gaga said "I had a boyfriend who told me I'd never succeed .... I said to him someday you won't be able to order a cup of coffee without hearing about me."

title: Did an Oklahoma State Legislator Call Pregnant Women 'Hosts'?
subtitle: Comments made by Republican State Rep. Justin Humphrey in February 2017 re-emerged online two years later.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Oklahoma State Rep. Justin Humphrey said he viewed a pregnant woman as a "host" for the fetus she carried.

title: Did Donald Trump, Jr. Call Teachers 'Losers' at His Father's Rally in Texas?
subtitle: The president's eldest son aired his grievances with educators during a political rally.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Donald Trump, Jr. referred to teachers as "losers" at a campaign event.

title: Did Lincoln Say 'We the People Are the Rightful Masters of Both Congress and the Courts'?
subtitle: "Don't believe everything you read on the Internet just because there's a photo with a quote next to it."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Abraham Lincoln once said that 'We the people are the rightful masters of both Congress and the Courts.'

title: Did a Landlord Tell Tenants That the Government Shutdown Could Cause Them to Be Evicted?
subtitle: As a federal government shutdown ran on for weeks, concerns mounted over its effects on renters who rely on federal subsidies.
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: Arkansas landlord Annette Cowen informed tenants at her rental properties they could face eviction if they failed to pay rent as a result of lacking the income provided by government housing subsidy programs.

title: Did Trump Use a Concrete Wall Metaphor During a 2004 Commencement Speech?
subtitle: Donald Trump in 2004: "'If there's a concrete wall in front of you, go through it, go over it, go around it. But get to the other side of that wall."
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Trump used a "concrete wall" metaphor during a commencement speech in 2004.

title: Did Florida State Rep. Kimberly Daniels Once Say, 'I Thank God for Slavery'?
subtitle: The Jacksonville Democrat's pronouncements as a preacher came under intense scrutiny in 2018.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Democratic Florida State Representative Kimberly Daniels once said, "I thank God for slavery."

title: Did CNN's Don Lemon Say the 'Biggest Terror Threat in This Country Is White Men'?
subtitle: "I keep trying to point out to people not to demonize any one group or any one ethnicity."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: CNN host Don Lemon said "the biggest terror threat in this country is white men."

title: Did Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Say We Need to 'Invent Technology That's Never Been Invented'?
subtitle: Representative-elect Ocasio-Cortez made the comment during a speech about environmentally sound new jobs.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Representative-elect Ocasio-Cortez said "we need to invent technology that's never even been invented yet."

title: Did a Retired Army General Call President Trump a 'Serious Threat to U.S. National Security'?
subtitle: Gen. Barry McCaffrey also asserted that the president was "under the sway" of his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin.
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Retired U.S. Army General Barry McCaffrey opined that President Trump poses a "serious threat to U.S. national security."

title: Did FDR's Vice-President Write an Op-Ed About 'American Fascism'?
subtitle: Henry A. Wallace's 1944 piece included a warning regarding the alliance of racists and "deliberate poisoners of public information."
author: Arturo Garcia
statement: While serving as U.S. Vice President, Henry A. Wallace wrote a piece warning Americans about the dangers of fascism.

title: Did Dick Van Dyke Say 'We Have to Stop a Man Who Wants to Be the Dictator'?
subtitle: In an interview just before the 2016 presidential election, the then-90-year-old comic actor leveled some harsh accusations against Republican candidate Donald Trump and his supporters.
author: David Emery
statement: Dick Van Dyke said of Donald Trump, "There are millions of people who share his anger, paranoia, and his hatred ... I think we have to stop a man who wants to be the dictator."

title: Did Ike Say If a Political Party Doesn't Advance a Moral Cause, Then It Is Merely a Conspiracy to Seize Power?
subtitle: "I have the most deep conviction that a political party can be called such only if its whole purposes are soundly based in some moral and spiritual values."
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Eisenhower said that a political party must be dedicated to the advancement of a moral cause, otherwise it is just a conspiracy to seize power.

title: Did Ann Coulter Tweet That 'Men Have No Choice But to Rape ...'?
subtitle: A controversial tweet by Ann Coulter is a few years old and was issued in response to another tweet.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Ann Coulter posted a tweet stating that "men have no choice but to rape because they have no opportunities to date attractive women?."

title: Did President Trump Say That 'Faith Is More Powerful Than Government?'
subtitle: The U.S. chief executive employed the phrase at a National Day of Prayer event in May 2018.
author: Dan Evon
statement: President Donald Trump once said that "faith is more powerful than government."

title: Did the Widow of 'American Sniper' Chris Kyle Criticize Nike's Colin Kaepernick Campaign?
subtitle: Taya Kyle wrote on Facebook that the ad campaign's message of "sacrificing everything" was "insulting to those who really have sacrificed everything."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: In September 2018, Taya Kyle posted a Facebook message that strongly criticized the tone and slogan of Nike's recently-unveiled campaign with Colin Kaepernick.

title: Did Michael Cohen Tweet at Hillary Clinton That Room and Board Will Be Free When She Goes to Prison?
subtitle: President Trump's long-time personal attorney deleted the tweet after pleading guilty to multiple counts relating to fraud and campaign finance violations.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: President Trump's long-time personal lawyer tweeted at Hillary Clinton that her room and board would be free in prison.

title: Did the Man Who Oversaw the Bin Laden Raid Say It Would Be 'An Honor' If President Trump Revoked His Security Clearance?
subtitle: William McRaven wrote "I would consider it an honor if you would revoke my security clearance as well, so I can add my name to the list of men and women who have spoken up against your presidency."
author: Dan MacGuill
statement: Retired Navy Admiral William McRaven wrote that he would "consider it an honor" if President Donald Trump revoked his security clearance.

title: Did Astronaut Mark Kelly Say the 'Space Force' Was a 'Dumb Idea?'
subtitle: A man who flew on several NASA Space Shuttle missions is not a supporter of the proposed Space Force.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Astronaut Mark Kelly said President Trump's proposed 'Space Force' military branch was a dumb idea.

title: Is This Audio of Detained Children Crying for Their Parents?
subtitle: ProPublica published a surreptitious recording of distressed immigrant children inside an unnamed detention facility.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: An audio clip captured distressed immigrant children crying for their parents in a detention facility.

title: Did Major General Paul D. Eaton Say Trump's Decertifying Iran Deal 'Dishonors America'?
subtitle: A meme reproduces a former general's comment about President Donald Trump's announcement that the U.S. would be withdrawing from a nuclear deal with Iran.
author: Snopes Staff
statement: Major General Paul Eaton said President Trump's decertification of an existing nuclear deal with Iran deal "dishonors America."

title: Did the NRA's Dana Loesch Tweet That CNN's Rick Sanchez Was 'Fired by a Jew?'
subtitle: A tweet posted in 2010 by NRA spokeswoman Dana Loesch about a fired CNN reporter was criticized several years later as anti-Semitic.
author: Dan Evon
statement: NRA spokesperson Dana Loesch tweeted "I bet [CNN reporter] Rick Sanchez was fired by a Jew."

title: Marjory Stoneman Douglas Quote About Activism?
subtitle: The environmental activist, journalist, and suffragette encouraged people to "be a nuisance" and to "never give up"  - even if discouraged by bad politics.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Marjory Stoneman Douglas encouraged activists to "be a nuisance" and to "never give up" even if discouraged by bad politics.

title: Did a Former Peace Corps Volunteer Defend Trump's Sh*thole Comments?
subtitle: An opinion piece arguing that "Trump is Right" about African countries was written by Karin McQuillan.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Former Peace Corps volunteer Karin McQuillan wrote an opinion piece arguing that President Trump was right about Africa.

title: Michael Hayden Said of NFL Protest Dispute 'Put Me Down with Kaepernick'?
subtitle: A viral quote about recent protests staged by NFL players was correctly attributed to former CIA Director Michael Hayden.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Michael Hayden said that he stood with Colin Kaepernick and other NFL Players in dispute over protests during the national anthem.

title: Did Leland Melvin Pen an Open Letter to Donald Trump?
subtitle: An open letter to President Trump addressing his comments about football players truly originated with astronaut and former NFL player Leland Melvin.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Astronaut and former NFL player Leland Melvin wrote an open letter to Donald Trump concerning the President's comments about the "Take a Knee" protest.

title: Did a Retired Marine Write an Open Letter to the NFL's Roger Goodell About Kneeling Football Players?
subtitle: A letter by Col. Jeffery Powers to the NFL's commissioner about football players kneeling during "The Star-Spangled Banner" is genuine.
author: Dan Evon
statement: Retired Marine Col. Jeffery Powers penned an open letter to NFL commissioner Roger Goodell describing how he felt about players kneeling during the national anthem.

title: Fred Rogers - 'Look for the Helpers'
subtitle: Television's children host Mr. Rogers said his mother responded to scary news by telling him, 'Look for the helpers.'
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Television's children host Mr. Rogers said his mother responded to scary news by telling him, 'Look for the helpers.'

title: Did History Professor Heather Richardson Posit the Immigration Ban Was a 'Shock Event'?
subtitle: A viral Facebook post holding that President Trump's controversial immigration ban was a "shock event" was an editorial item by a Boston College history professor.
author: Kim LaCapria
statement: Boston-based history professor Heather Richardson surmised President Trump's Executive Order on immigration was a "shock event."

title: Did Trump Say Crashing the Economy Would Get People Back to Work?
subtitle: "We have a lot of people that are unemployed that have no idea of getting a job."
author: Bethania Palma
statement: Donald Trump said that America's economy crashing would get unemployed people off of welfare rolls and back to work.

title: Did Trump Ally Carl Paladino Say Michelle Obama Should Go Live in a Cave with a Gorilla?
subtitle: The former co-chairman of Donald Trump's New York presidential campaign also said he hoped President Obama died of 'mad cow disease.'
author: David Emery
statement: Former Trump campaign official Carl Paladino said he hopes President Obama dies of mad cow disease and Michelle Obama goes to live in a cave in Africa with a gorilla.

title: Texas Man Speaks About Black Lives Matter
subtitle: An anonymous resident of East Texas shared his opinion of the Black Lives Matter movement.
author: Dan Evon
statement: A resident of East Texas shared his opinion of the Black Lives Matter movement.

title: An Ode to America
subtitle: Romanian newspaperman Cornel Nistorescu penned a popular pro-America editorial immediately after the 9/11 attacks.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Romanian newspaperman Cornel Nistorescu penned a pro-America editorial immediately after the 9/11 terrorist attacks.

title: Allen West Pens Open Letter to Colin Kaepernick
subtitle: Conservative commentator and retired Army officer Allen West blasted the 49ers quarterback for protesting during the national anthem.
author: Bethania Palma
statement: The former Florida representative and wrote an angry column about 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick on his personal blog.

title: Dr. Starner Jones: 'Why Pay for the Care of the Careless?'
subtitle: Letter to the editor by a Mississippi physician criticizes a patient's lifestyle choices.
author: David Mikkelson

title: Did a South Carolina Politician Call Women a 'Lesser Cut of Meat'?
subtitle: "I have proven that women can effectively serve in the Legislature, and one of my colleagues has proven capable of talking like an idiot."
author: Snopes Staff
statement: South Carolina state Senator Thomas Corbin told a colleague at a dinner function that women are a "lesser cut of meat."

title: Did an Ex-FBI Agent Write This Open Letter to Eric Holder?
subtitle: "Until today, I chose to hold my tongue."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former FBI Agent K. Dee McCown published an open letter to Attorney General Eric Holder criticizing his handling of race-based issues.

title: Margaret Thatcher on Socialism
subtitle: Did Margaret Thatcher once say that 'The trouble with socialism is that eventually you run out of other people's money'?
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Margaret Thatcher once said that "The trouble with Socialism is that eventually you run out of other people's money."

title: The Lights Are Going Out All Over Europe
subtitle: Dutch politician Geert Wilders delivered an anti-Islam speech on the scenario of "America as the Last Man Standing."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Dutch politician Geert Wilders delivered a speech on the scenario of "America as the Last Man Standing."

title: President Harry Truman on Republicans
subtitle: "I have discovered where the Republicans stand on most of the major issues.  Since they won't tell you themselves, I am going to tell you."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A quote reproduces a statement by President Harry Truman about Republicans.

title: Dennis Guthrie's Letter to Nancy Pelosi
subtitle: An op-ed piece about health insurance reform legislation prompted a Charlotte lawyer to send a critical letter to Rep. Nancy Pelosi.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A Charlotte lawyer named Dennis Guthrie sent a critical letter to Rep. Nancy Pelosi.

title: Charley Reese's Final Column
subtitle: The journalist penned an editorial about 545 people being 'responsible for the domestic problems that plague' the U.S.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Charley Reese penned an editorial about 545 people being "responsible for the domestic problems that plague" the U.S.

title: 'I Have a Plan to Destroy America'
subtitle: A former Colorado governor delivered a speech on the destructive effects of multiculturalism on the U.S.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: Former Colorado governor Richard Lamm delivered a speech on the perils of multiculturalism.

title: The Difference Between the Bible and the Constitution
subtitle: "I didn't put my hand on the Constitution and swear to uphold the Bible."
author: David Mikkelson
statement: A constitutional law professor quipped on the difference between the Bible and the Constitution during a debate over same-sex marriage.

title: Did H. L. Mencken Say the 'White House Will Be Adorned by a Downright Moron'?
subtitle: The legendary newspaperman addressed the difficulties of good men reaching national office when such campaigns were necessarily conducted remotely.
author: David Mikkelson
statement: H. L. Mencken wrote that eventually "the White House will be adorned by a downright moron."

title: Did John Wayne Say Native Americans 'Selfishly' Tried to Keep Their Land?
subtitle: The popular actor supposedly maintained that the taking of land from Native Americans was justifiable because they were 'selfishly trying to keep it for themselves.'
author: David Mikkelson
statement: John Wayne once said that the taking of land from Native Americans was justifiable because they were 'selfishly trying to keep it for themselves.'
